title: PM Modi Accepts Invitation To Inaugurate the BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi On Feb 14
text:
New Delhi: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday accepted an invitation to inaugurate the BAPS Hindu Mandir in UAE's Abu Dhabi. The inauguration ceremony is scheduled to take place on February 14. An hour-long meeting was held at PM Modi's official residence in the evening. "On behalf of BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi, Pujya Swami Ishwarcharandas and Swami Brahmaviharidas, along with the board of directors, extended a heartfelt invitation to the Honorable Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi for the inauguration ceremony scheduled for 14 February 2024," BAPS Swaminarayan Sanstha said in a statement.
"Delighted by this gesture, Prime Minister Modi graciously accepted the invitation, expressing his enthusiastic support for the historic and iconic temple. Pujya Swami Ishwarcharandas traditionally honored the Prime Minister by adorning him with a garland and draping a saffron shawl over his shoulders, acknowledging his significant contributions to our nation and the world," it added.
During the meeting with PM Modi, Swami Brahmaviharidas showcased the latest update of the BAPS Hindu Mandir in Abu Dhabi. He emphasised the temple's intricate carvings and all-inclusive grandeur.
"It will reflect the ideal of Vasudhaiva Kutumbakam - an ideal spiritual space, not merely rooted in beliefs and traditions, but a confluence of diverse cultures and civilizations. The essence of spiritual harmony, symbolizing the path forward," the PM said as Quote: d in the BAP's statement.
The meeting went on for almost 45 minutes.
